meanings.definition: Not alike in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were dissimilar in style and color.
meanings.sent2: The twins had dissimilar personalities despite looking identical.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the dissimilar reactions of the cats to the new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her taste in music was as dissimilar to mine as night is to day.
meanings.sent5: The dissimilar shapes of the clouds made the sky look like a painting.

meanings.sent1: The two houses had dissimilar designs and colors.
meanings.sent2: Their opinions on the matter were dissimilar, leading to a heated debate.
meanings.sent3: It seemed dissimilar to see a penguin in the desert.
meanings.sent4: Their paths in life were as dissimilar as a river and a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The dissimilar flavors of the ice cream created a unique taste experience.
